snippet: A split over the lessons of the 2012 election reflect an intensifying debate in the Republican Party: whether to change with the times to expand their appeal or reject pressure for moderation.
abstract: Split over lessons of 2012 election at Conservative Political Action Conference reflects an intensifying debate in Republican Party: whether to change with the times to expand their appeal or reject pressure for moderation in belief that only an ideologically pure message will rally voters.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and RICHARD W. STEVENSON
byline.contributor: Sarah Wheaton contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A split over the lessons of the 2012 election reflect an intensifying debate in the Republican Party: whether to change with the times to expand their appeal or reject pressure for moderation.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Divisions Fester at CPAC Retreat
headline.main: G.O.P. Divisions Fester at Conservative Retreat
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Divisions Fester at Conservative Retreat
